definition: eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.chinese: 偵探長的眼珠子都凸出來了。
眼鏡後面的眼珠子突凸出來。
和一盆有趣的眼珠子花。

sentences.english: The thou Ao eye pupil son turns around, one slavering of face facial expression.
sentences.chinese: 古傲眼珠子轉來轉去，一臉的垂涎表情。

sentences.english: His eyes rolled backwards and he passed out.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼珠子向後翻，然後就暈過去了。

sentences.english: Her eyes had sunken deep into her skull. She slept most of the time.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼珠子深深地陷了下去，大半時間都在昏睡。
眼鏡後面的眼珠子突凸出來。

sentences.english: There is no physical mechanism involved in a sneeze that could make your eyes pop out.
sentences.chinese: 打噴嚏不會涉及到任何身理機制導致眼珠子彈出的。

definition: eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
whirling/spinning around and around/round and plump (e.g. of fruit)
to roll rapidly/to spin/Taiwan pr. [gu2 lu5]
(onom.) rolling around/spinning/also pr. [gu1 lu1 lu1]/Taiwan pr. [gu2 lu4 lu5]
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
